title: Synthetic Recap
body:
ORLANDO – In the record books, it will simply be a 115-89 victory for the Sacramento Kings over the Orlando Magic. But for those who witnessed it, it was the night Mitch Richmond authored a masterpiece.

From the opening tip, Richmond was not merely a participant; he was a force of nature. The Orlando defense, helpless and searching for answers, could only watch as the Kings’ guard put on a breathtaking shooting clinic. When the final horn sounded, the stat sheet told a historic tale: Richmond had poured in a career-high 47 points, a number so colossal it dwarfed all other aspects of the contest.

His performance was one of ruthless efficiency and explosive scoring runs. He attacked from every conceivable angle, connecting from deep, mid-range, and at the rim with equal authority. Each basket seemed to sap the spirit from the Orlando Arena crowd and the Magic players alike. The game’s final margin, a 26-point Kings rout, was almost secondary; this was Richmond’s solo recital, a personal onslaught that carved up an entire team.

While Chris Webbergrabbed a game-high 14 rebounds and the Kings’ ball movement was sharp, this night belonged to one man. Richmond’s 47-point eruption was not just a season-high or a personal best; it was a statement performance, the kind that etches a player’s name into franchise lore.

For the Magic, the 26-point loss was a harsh lesson, but they were ultimately bystanders in a singular, spectacular event. On this night in Orlando, Mitch Richmond didn’t just win a game; he seized the spotlight and delivered a performance for the ages.
